answers.author: Lorenda Volker
answers.text:
We use the "EQ in Action Profile" developed by Learning in Action Technologies, Inc. (www.learninginacton.com).  Our Organizational Development Coordinator administers the assessment and provides the feedback individually to participants.  Here's the contact information I have: (425) 641-7426 or liat@learninginaction.com

answers.author: Joshua Freedman
answers.text:
Hi Tom - I'm the CEO of Six Seconds, The Emotional Intelligence Network - and we publish a toolset called the SEI.  http://www.6seconds.org/tools/sei -- very well validated, global, and actionable.  There are 3 intro tools + 3 in-depth tools in the line, and these have been used by quite a few gov't agencies -- including some county agencies, and further afield the UN as well as US Navy & Marine Corps.  Happy to talk w/ you about this: josh@6seconds.org

Happy to talk w/ you about this: josh@6seconds.org

answers.author: Jesse Himes
answers.text:
Hi Tom,
You might find this document pretty useful. It goes into detail about what emotional intelligence (EI) is and what it means. It also details a six-phase EI assessment, training, and coaching program. http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/2664/Do_You_Know_What_Your_Emotional_IQ_Is
Hope this helped!
Jesse Himes, Knowledge Network Intern, jhimes@icma.org

author: Tom Richardson
text: We are a human services department in a California county and we're looking for a useful emotional intelligence assessment tool for participants in our leadership development program. We're also interested in having one or two people in our organization get certified in administering the assessment. Do you have a tool that you have used that you would recommend?
title: Emotional Intelligence assessment
